content.raw: All documented. I like these local functions because they don't "pollute" the API, but a class with static methods would also work.
content.html: All documented. I like these local functions because they don't "pollute" the API, but a class with static methods would also work.

content.raw: I think an error is better here, since these are not valid SVG commands (until there's a new version of the SVG standard)
content.html: I think an error is better here, since these are not valid SVG commands (until there's a new version of the SVG standard)

content.raw: Sounds good
content.html: Sounds good

content.raw: Unfortunately, I haven't had time to fix it yet. Its not a problem with the transforms themselves, it looks like a bug that creates a single polyline out of multiple paths, which ends up transforming too many points. Let's make it another PR, since it looks like the problem was there before.
content.html: Unfortunately, I haven't had time to fix it yet. Its not a problem with the transforms themselves, it looks like a bug that creates a single polyline out of multiple paths, which ends up transforming too many points. Let's make it another PR, since it looks like the problem was there before.

content.raw: Has this already been addressed? Or will it be addressed in a future PR?
content.html: Has this already been addressed? Or will it be addressed in a future PR?

content.raw:
This example has 3 circles. The 2 small ones are the same path, but one of these circles has a "matrix" transform that makes the center of that circle coincide with the center of the large circle.
I just noticed that the matrix transform is not working, and I should fix that shortly.
content.html: This example has 3 circles. The 2 small ones are the same path, but one of these circles has a "matrix" transform that makes the center of that circle coincide with the center of the large circle. I just noticed that the matrix transform is not working, and I should fix that shortly.

content.raw:
You are right. And because <g> elements can also contain other <g> elements, the XML parsing needs to be enhanced (and that can be part of porting to libtinyxml2).
What adds to the confusion is that in transform3.svg, the transform was specified after the coordinates, and so the transformation was not even applied. Transform3 is also uncovering a problem with matrix transformation.
content.html: You are right. And because <g> elements can also contain other <g> elements, the XML parsing needs to be enhanced (and that can be part of porting to libtinyxml2). What adds to the confusion is that in transform3.svg, the transform was specified after the coordinates, and so the transformation was not even applied. Transform3 is also uncovering a problem with matrix transformation.

content.raw: What confused me was that only transforms immediately under <g> are not supported, but those under a <path> which is inside a <g> are supposed to work, right? (Such as in `transform3.svg`)
content.html: What confused me was that only transforms immediately under <g> are not supported, but those under a <path> which is inside a <g> are supposed to work, right? (Such as in transform3.svg)

content.raw: Thank you. I have added the file attached to the bug report as "test/data/svg/transform3.svg".
content.html: Thank you. I have added the file attached to the bug report as "test/data/svg/transform3.svg".

content.raw: Transforms inside <g> are not in this PR. Also, multiple transforms (ex: "skewY(34) skewX(32)") aren't either.
content.html: Transforms inside <g> are not in this PR. Also, multiple transforms (ex: "skewY(34) skewX(32)") aren't either.

content.raw: Removing my approval for now since I had misunderstood what kind of transforms inside <g> were supposed to be supported. Reviewing again soon.
content.html: Removing my approval for now since I had misunderstood what kind of transforms inside <g> were supposed to be supported. Reviewing again soon.

content.raw: The problem is actually an assertion in the GTS triangulation library (these are enabled in debug mode), and not an uncaught exception.
content.html: The problem is actually an assertion in the GTS triangulation library (these are enabled in debug mode), and not an uncaught exception.

content.raw: Check added, thanks.
content.html: Check added, thanks.
